criteria.name: Completeness
criteria.description: Are all required components present (YAML, TOC, Read This First, Workflow checklist, Step details, Resources, Rubric)?

scores.1: Missing 3+ major components (e.g., no workflow, no resources, no rubric)
scores.2: Missing 1-2 major components or several minor elements
scores.3: All major components present but some minor elements missing (e.g., one step lacks goal statement)
scores.4: All required components present with very minor gaps (e.g., missing one optional section)
scores.5: All components fully present and comprehensive, nothing missing

criteria.name: Clarity
criteria.description: Are instructions clear, unambiguous, and easy to understand? Is language precise and terminology well-defined?

scores.1: Instructions are confusing, ambiguous, or contradictory. Unclear what to do.
scores.2: Many instructions are vague or require interpretation. Key terms undefined.
scores.3: Most instructions are clear but some ambiguity remains. Key terms mostly defined.
scores.4: Instructions are clear and precise with minor ambiguity in edge cases only.
scores.5: All instructions crystal clear, unambiguous, and precise. All terms well-defined.

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: Can this skill be followed step-by-step? Are steps concrete and executable?

scores.1: Steps are too abstract or theoretical to execute. No clear action guidance.
scores.2: Some steps are actionable but many remain too high-level or vague.
scores.3: Most steps are actionable with concrete actions, but some need more specificity.
scores.4: Nearly all steps provide clear, executable actions with minor gaps.
scores.5: All steps are concrete, specific, and immediately executable. Clear action verbs throughout.

criteria.name: Structure & Organization
criteria.description: Is the skill logically organized? Is navigation easy? Do resource links work correctly?

scores.1: Disorganized, hard to navigate. No clear structure. Broken or missing links.
scores.2: Some organization but flow is unclear. Several broken links or poor organization.
scores.3: Logical organization with minor navigation issues. Most links work correctly.
scores.4: Well-organized and easy to navigate. All links work. Very minor structural issues.
scores.5: Excellently organized with perfect navigation. Logical flow. All links and anchors work perfectly.

criteria.name: Triggers & When to Use
criteria.description: Is it clear WHEN to use this skill? Are triggers specific and recognizable? Does YAML description focus on WHEN not WHAT?

scores.1: No clear triggers. YAML description describes WHAT the skill does, not WHEN to use it.
scores.2: Vague triggers that are hard to recognize. YAML description partially WHEN-focused.
scores.3: Triggers present and somewhat specific. YAML description adequately WHEN-focused.
scores.4: Clear, specific triggers that are easy to recognize. YAML description well WHEN-focused.
scores.5: Excellent, specific triggers with clear examples. YAML description perfectly WHEN-focused with multiple trigger scenarios.

criteria.name: Resource Quality
criteria.description: Do resources follow WHY/WHAT structure? Do WHY sections activate context appropriately? Do WHAT sections provide actionable guidance?

scores.1: Resources don't follow WHY/WHAT structure. Missing critical content.
scores.2: Partial WHY/WHAT structure. WHY sections over-explain or under-explain. WHAT sections vague.
scores.3: Resources follow WHY/WHAT structure adequately. Some sections could be clearer or more focused.
scores.4: Resources follow WHY/WHAT structure well. WHY activates context appropriately. WHAT provides clear guidance.
scores.5: Resources perfectly structured with WHY/WHAT. WHY sections perfectly prime context. WHAT sections provide excellent, specific guidance.

criteria.name: User Collaboration
criteria.description: Are user choice points clearly marked? Are options presented with trade-offs? Does the skill appropriately involve the user in decisions?

scores.1: No user involvement. Skill makes all decisions or lacks decision points entirely.
scores.2: Minimal user involvement. Few choice points. Options not well explained.
scores.3: Some user collaboration. Key choice points marked. Options explained adequately.
scores.4: Good user collaboration. Most choice points marked. Options presented with clear trade-offs.
scores.5: Excellent collaboration. All choice points clearly marked. Options presented with comprehensive trade-off analysis. User empowered to make informed decisions.

criteria.name: File Size Compliance
criteria.description: Are all files under 500 lines? Is content appropriately distributed across files?

scores.1: Multiple files significantly over 500 lines (>600 lines)
scores.2: One or more files moderately over limit (500-600 lines)
scores.3: All files under 500 lines but some are close to limit (450-499)
scores.4: All files comfortably under 500 lines (most under 450)
scores.5: All files well under 500 lines with good content distribution

passing_note: Average score must be â‰¥ 3.5 for skill to be considered complete and ready for use. Any individual criterion scoring below 3 requires revision before delivery. After scoring, present results to user with specific improvement suggestions for any criterion scoring below 4.
